column4: I compiled a custom kernel and it has no screen output on bootup untill I see the nvidia splash screen and xdm login. What did I do wrong?
Is there a boot option I need to pas to the kernel?
No, I think you're just missing console support.
Did you build the kernel with an initrd?
For starters, remove the 'quiet' from the grub kernel line. That'll help.
ok I will try removing quiet
Make fedora boot with "root=LABEL=core3" instead of root=LABEL=/
You may need to also mount the fedora partition in ubuntu and edit Fedora's /etc/fstab to reflect that change.
I tried that but Fedora still looks for /
I deleted the partiton and labeled it / but when I dd if=image of/dev/hda2 the label went back to core3 so the label is in the partition image somewhere
Hmmyah. You can use 'tune2fs' to edit it.
I deleted the partiton and labeled it / but when I dd if=image_core3  of=/dev/hda2 the label went back to core3 so the label is in the partition image somewhere
tune2fs did the job, thank you profoundly!!!
